org.efaps.jaas

Class ImportHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.jaas.LoginHandler
      • org.efaps.jaas.ImportHandler

  • public class ImportHandler
extends LoginHandler
    The class is used to import from all JAAS system the user into eFaps so that all users which could authentificate them self outside eFaps are known inside eFaps (e.g. to assign them for access or to send then an email).
    To start an import, the class must be instantiated and method importPersons() must be called.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    The eFaps Team

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void importPersons()
      The method calls first method readPersons() to read all persons in the cache.
      protected void readPersons()
      The algorithm for identification of persons with specified key and name in a JAAS system is: search person by key in eFaps if not found search person by name in eFaps If no person inside eFaps is found, search if another JAAS system identifies a person with the same name!
      If an exception is thrown inside called methods, the exceptions are only written to the log as errors.
      protected void updatePersons()
      Each found person is updated in eFaps (or created if not already existing).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImportHandler

        public ImportHandler(String _application)
        Constructor to initialize the login handler. If null is given to the application name, the default value defined in #application is used.
        Parameters:
        _application - application name of the JAAS configuration

    • Method Detail

      • importPersons

        public void importPersons()
        The method calls first method readPersons() to read all persons in the cache. Then all found persons are updated with the information from.
        See Also:
        readPersons(), updatePersons()

      • readPersons

        protected void readPersons()
        The algorithm for identification of persons with specified key and name in a JAAS system is:
        • search person by key in eFaps
        • if not found search person by name in eFaps
        If no person inside eFaps is found, search if another JAAS system identifies a person with the same name!
        If an exception is thrown inside called methods, the exceptions are only written to the log as errors.

      • updatePersons

        protected void updatePersons()

        Each found person is updated in eFaps (or created if not already existing). The methods from the login handler LoginHandler are used for the update.

        Each user name is written as debug information to the log file.

        If an exception is thrown inside called methods, the exceptions are only written to the log as errors.

        See Also:
        LoginHandler.getPerson(LoginContext), LoginHandler.createPerson(LoginContext), LoginHandler.updatePerson(LoginContext, Person), LoginHandler.updateRoles(LoginContext, Person), LoginHandler.updateGroups(LoginContext, Person)
